message.content:
Below is one systematic way to arrive at (and then build) the two structures exactly as shown, without rotating any blocks beyond how they appear in the dictionary.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  ANALYSIS OF THE MAIN (TARGET) IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
•  The scene actually contains two separate builds:

  A)  Left “Tower” Structure
     – Total of 9 blocks
     – Five vertical layers:
        1)  A flat yellow rectangular base  
        2)  Two orange cylinders standing upright (pillars)  
        3)  Another flat yellow rectangular piece bridging those pillars  
        4)  Three small blocks in a row on top (blue–red–blue)  
        5)  A “roof” composed of two orange wedge pieces meeting at the apex

  B)  Right “Chair‐like” Structure
     – Total of 8 blocks
     – Four layers:
        1)  Bottom row of three red blocks (two rectangular on the sides, one arch in the center)  
        2)  One large yellow rectangular piece bridging across those three  
        3)  A red rectangular block plus a second red arch on top, with a small yellow rectangular piece bridging them  
        4)  A single orange wedge resting on top

•  Grand total: 17 blocks (9 in the tower + 8 in the chair‐like structure).


────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING THE REQUIRED DICTIONARY BLOCKS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Below are the dictionary‐index matches.  (Recall: we must use each piece *exactly* as pictured—no extra rotations.)

A)  Left Tower (9 blocks):
   1)  Bottom horizontal yellow bar → index 9  
   2)  Two vertical orange pillars → index 11 (twice)  
   3)  Top horizontal yellow bar → index 9 (a second copy)  
   4)  Top row of three small blocks:  
       – Center red block → index 6  
       – Blue blocks left & right → index 8 (twice)  
   5)  Two orange wedges for the roof → index 14 and 16

B)  Right Chair‐Like Structure (8 blocks):
   1)  Bottom layer (3 red pieces):  
       – Left red rectangle → index 6  
       – Center red arch (front‐to‐back opening) → index 1  
       – Right red rectangle → index 6 (another copy)  
   2)  Second layer:  
       – Large yellow rectangle bridging → index 9  
   3)  Third layer:  
       – Red arch (side‐to‐side opening) → index 2  
       – Red rectangular block → index 6  
       – Small yellow rectangle bridging → index 10  
   4)  Top wedge:  
       – Orange wedge → index 15

Hence the indices needed are:
•  #1, #2 (red arches)  
•  #6 (red rectangle × several copies)  
•  #8 (blue small block × 2)  
•  #9 (yellow rectangle × 3)  
•  #10 (yellow rectangle, smaller orientation)  
•  #11 (orange cylinder × 2)  
•  #14, #15, #16 (orange wedges)


────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Below is a possible build order, starting from the tower on the left, then the chair‐like shape on the right.  Use the exact block indices as listed.

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 9        (left tower base)
  Step2:  Move block with index 11       (first orange pillar)
  Step3:  Move block with index 11       (second orange pillar)
  Step4:  Move block with index 9        (yellow bar across pillars)
  Step5:  Move block with index 8        (blue top‐left)
  Step6:  Move block with index 6        (red top‐center)
  Step7:  Move block with index 8        (blue top‐right)
  Step8:  Move block with index 14       (left roof wedge)
  Step9:  Move block with index 16       (right roof wedge)
  Step10: Move block with index 6        (right structure bottom‐left red)
  Step11: Move block with index 1        (bottom‐center arch)
  Step12: Move block with index 6        (bottom‐right red)
  Step13: Move block with index 9        (large yellow bar across bottom row)
  Step14: Move block with index 2        (red arch atop second layer)
  Step15: Move block with index 6        (red rectangular back)
  Step16: Move block with index 10       (small yellow bridging piece)
  Step17: Move block with index 15       (orange wedge on top)
}

That completes the two structures exactly as shown.
